message.content: We begin by rewriting $3$ and $81$ as powers of $9$: $$3^n = 3 \cdot 9^3 \cdot 81^2 = 3 \cdot (3^2)^3 \cdot (3^4)^2.$$Applying the power-of-a-power rule and further simplifying, we have: $$3^n = 3 \cdot 3^{2 \cdot 3} \cdot 3^{4 \cdot 2} = 3^{1 + 6 + 8} = 3^{15}.$$Therefore, $n = \boxed{15}$.
